bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Gordon worked for the Library of Jewish Information, the American Jewish Committee and was the author of many studies on East European affairs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: These two boxes were separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records TAM 023. This material was created by Joseph Gordon. No materials were removed from this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records, this two box collection contains typed and handwritten manuscripts, articles, papers, and notes written by Joseph Gordon as well as correspondence. The articles, written in English, German, and Czech, mostly concern German, Russian, and Eastern European matters and especially anti-semitism. Some articles have an anti-communist bent, particularly those written for the U.S. International Information Administration of the U.S. State Department.

According to the original folder titles, Joseph Gordon often wrote under two different pseudonyms: Josef Guttman and Peter Meyer. Box 1 contains materials written by Joseph Gordon as himself and also as Josef Guttman. Box 2 is entirely devoted to the writings of Joseph Gordon as Peter Meyer. Both boxes contain typed and handwritten "manuscripts." Materials are not separated by language, so some folders may contain material in several different languages.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: This material was found in repository. The accession number associated with this material is 1950.031.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2047. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, a collection level finding aid was created and the material was moved to archival housing. In 2015 the finding aid was updated and a folder list was created.
